title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CLEVELAND – In a season defined by its elegance, the Chicago Bulls authored a masterpiece of pure, unadulterated grit.

In a rock fight masquerading as a basketball game, the Bulls defeated the Cleveland Cavaliers 79-70 in a defensive clinic that will be remembered not for its beauty, but for its brutality. And at the heart of the struggle stood Michael Jordan, who turned the United Center into a personal proving ground.

On a night where offensive flow was a casualty, Jordan waged a one-man war against the Cavaliers. He poured in a game-high 43 points, a staggering figure that accounted for over half of his team’s entire output. In a contest where no other player on either team could crack 20 points, Jordan’s scoring was not just prolific; it was essential for survival. Each basket was a hard-fought prize against a relentless Cleveland defense.

The Cavaliers, led by Shawn Kemp’s 14 points and 11 rebounds, hung around through sheer force of will, but they had no answer for the singular force wearing number 23. Every time Cleveland threatened to close the gap, Jordan responded with a demoralizing bucket, a testament to his unmatched will to win.

This was not the fluid, high-flying Bulls offense the world had come to admire. This was a bare-knuckle brawl, and Jordan was the last man standing, dragging his team across the finish line with a historic, iron-willed performance that encapsulated his greatness. It was 43 points carved from stone, a testament to the fact that even on an ugly night, His Airness could still create a thing of brutal, winning beauty.
